commit_message:
Add trustee domain

This patch set allows for searching the trustee user in a specified
domain rather than just the "default" domain.

Change-Id: I53ee6816e02c25e577244015fe5aea0870e0fd32
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: Switch subnet-pool id for name
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-12 17:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': "Switch subnet-pool id for name

This commit switches subnet-pool id for name on the create subnet
funcion on our devstack plugin as it's currently broken because of the
migration in between q-* and neutron-* services in devstack.

This intends to be a temporary measure until we get our dependencies
sorted out.

Change-Id: Ibaf0eaf9b1dcacebf2c38e81cbd7f6136ade556b
"}]
commit_message:
Switch subnet-pool id for name

This commit switches subnet-pool id for name on the create subnet
funcion on our devstack plugin as it's currently broken because of the
migration in between q-* and neutron-* services in devstack.

This intends to be a temporary measure until we get our dependencies
sorted out.

Change-Id: Ibaf0eaf9b1dcacebf2c38e81cbd7f6136ade556b

subject: Panko api wsgi changed path for Ubuntu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-11 09:37:12.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/panko_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/basic_panko_spec.rb', 'manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Panko api wsgi changed path for Ubuntu

When installing the panko-api and panko-common
packages for Ubuntu the path to the wsgi script is
no longer /usr/share/panko-common/app.wsgi but is
now /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/panko/api/app.wsgi

This patch changes that script path. It depends on the
Gnocchi change in order to test this since Gnocchi has
to be fixed in order to run testing. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548032/

Depends-On: I070f88dd40ca4129cbd3abf5b4f5ecb511b2895e
Change-Id: I066bd87ce839d380942adcb73fcaa6d915f801c1
(cherry picked from commit 4a890fc2f1f61505b74aa52a3c75e6791800e574)
'}]
commit_message:
Panko api wsgi changed path for Ubuntu

When installing the panko-api and panko-common
packages for Ubuntu the path to the wsgi script is
no longer /usr/share/panko-common/app.wsgi but is
now /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/panko/api/app.wsgi

This patch changes that script path. It depends on the
Gnocchi change in order to test this since Gnocchi has
to be fixed in order to run testing. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/548032/

Depends-On: I070f88dd40ca4129cbd3abf5b4f5ecb511b2895e
Change-Id: I066bd87ce839d380942adcb73fcaa6d915f801c1
(cherry picked from commit 4a890fc2f1f61505b74aa52a3c75e6791800e574)

commit_message:
Use rest_status_code for api-ref response codes

Rather than our freeform way of listing response codes in our
api-ref, we should be using the os-api-ref extension option to
get nicely formatted response code listings.

https://docs.openstack.org/os-api-ref/latest/usage.html#rest-status-code

Change-Id: Iee21f54fe7cf0ea28258966e2d0f8fa2849c83f2

subject: Re-implement novaclient bits removed in 10.0
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-03-13 14:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/api/compute_v2.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/host.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_host.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/api/test_compute_v2.py', 'openstackclient/network/common.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Re-implement novaclient bits removed in 10.0

a)

/os-floating-ips was removed in Compute API 2.36 and from novaclient's
Python API in 10.0

Add to api.computev2:
floating_ip_add()
floating_ip_remove()

Convert add floating IP command to nova-net/neutron split:
"server add floating ip"
"server remove floating ip"

b)

/os-hosts was removed in Compute API 2.43 and from novaclient's
Python API in 10.0.

Add to api.computev2:
host_list()
host_set()
host_show()

Convert host commands to use intenal api:
"host list"
"host set"
"host show"

c)

The introduction of the Network-style commands into the server group
broke cliff's autoprogram directive as it executes the get_parser() methods
without fully initializing the Command object.

NOTE: This is really three reviews squashed to get through the gate in one pass.

Depends-on: Id6de87211d6c4ea8fd14aa9203d8d5b17e9e2f04
Change-Id: I5116086f9a9e4b2b31a744bf8f4558c79f0bfe59
'}]
commit_message:
Re-implement novaclient bits removed in 10.0

a)

/os-floating-ips was removed in Compute API 2.36 and from novaclient's
Python API in 10.0

Add to api.computev2:
floating_ip_add()
floating_ip_remove()

Convert add floating IP command to nova-net/neutron split:
"server add floating ip"
"server remove floating ip"

b)

/os-hosts was removed in Compute API 2.43 and from novaclient's
Python API in 10.0.

Add to api.computev2:
host_list()
host_set()
host_show()

Convert host commands to use intenal api:
"host list"
"host set"
"host show"

c)

The introduction of the Network-style commands into the server group
broke cliff's autoprogram directive as it executes the get_parser() methods
without fully initializing the Command object.

NOTE: This is really three reviews squashed to get through the gate in one pass.

Depends-on: Id6de87211d6c4ea8fd14aa9203d8d5b17e9e2f04
Change-Id: I5116086f9a9e4b2b31a744bf8f4558c79f0bfe59

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14629, 'name': 'HPE Proliant', 'email': 'proliantutils@gmail.com', 'username': 'proliantci'}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23356, 'name': 'wanghaijun', 'email': 'wanghj@awcloud.com', 'username': 'wanghaijun'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-23 16:33:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "[devstack] block iPXE boot from HTTPS TempURLs

While generally supported by iPXE, in DevStack we do not have any
facilities in place to boot iPXE from a HTTPS URL when the server is
using a custom certificate.
This is moslty concerning ability to boot iPXE directly from Swift's
TempURL when SSL is enabled on Swift in DevStack.

Just die with proper message when IRONIC_IPXE_USE_SWIFT and tls-proxy
are both enabled.

Change-Id: Ie0e01828f05b2706d310d8110e6e8dd8c4a03e4e
"}]
commit_message:
[devstack] block iPXE boot from HTTPS TempURLs

While generally supported by iPXE, in DevStack we do not have any
facilities in place to boot iPXE from a HTTPS URL when the server is
using a custom certificate.
This is moslty concerning ability to boot iPXE directly from Swift's
TempURL when SSL is enabled on Swift in DevStack.

Just die with proper message when IRONIC_IPXE_USE_SWIFT and tls-proxy
are both enabled.

Change-Id: Ie0e01828f05b2706d310d8110e6e8dd8c4a03e4e

commit_message:
Move resource class fields

Move the ResourceClass field to its own package, and move that package
to the top of the nova hierarchy since it is used by both nova tooling
and placement tooling but we don't want the placement version to have to
incorporate the nova code. Eventually we'd like to see an
os-resource-classes library, similar to os-traits, which will serve this
functionality. This is a step in that direction.

Changes in this patch are quite widespread, but are mostly only changes
of imports.

Change-Id: Iea182341f9419cb514a044f76864d6bec60a3683

commit_message:
kernel: make ExtraKernelModules and ExtraSysctlSettings role-specific

Allow to configure extra Kernel modules and extra sysctl settings per role
and not only global to the whole deployment.
The two parameters that can be role-specific are ExtraKernelModules and
ExtraSysctlSettings.

Depends-On: I2b26ce4f9d19dbf66da1b4382d7ffd653e67a92e
Change-Id: Iaafd0133df7ecd01a338f1b4deb3b159c2d9c6f1
(cherry picked from commit da1ed3d19c54b5f60fdc883fd4f11f613914c854)

commit_message:
Don't double load config

This isn't necessary and will likely have some bad side effects
because re-calling the conf object clears all previously registered
opts, which defeats the purpose of the second call.

Change-Id: I59bd78e85b3d55aea23b46809f4de678d394f66d
Related-Bug: 1751815

commit_message:
Adding the class and mac approach as dpdk-devargs in mellanox ConnectX-3

Some NICs (i.e. Mellanox ConnectX-3) have only one PCI address
associated with multiple ports. Using a PCI address as dpdk-devargs
in OvsDpdkPort won't work. Instead, class and mac approach is used
dpdk-devargs="class=eth,mac=<MAC>"
see this http://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/howto/dpdk/

Closes-Bug: #1754256
Change-Id: I29de6e82a0897ee46953a1e6a966e9c5790068c9
(cherry picked from commit aeaa6fe62b39a00f3b075a94c076f267f0c70af0)

commit_message:
Adding a workaround for enabling steering in ConnectX-3 devices

This file will add this configuration
"options mlx4_core log_num_mgm_entry_size=-1" to
/etc/modprobe.d/mlx4.conf file in order to enable steering in
ConnectX-3 devices and then will rebuild the initramfs at the first
boot stage

Closes-Bug: #1754260
Change-Id: Ia64e62e7fdb70e19be7b0a5cee163bd03c6de65d
(cherry picked from commit bbc8e0ac3e37752b4f114811878cabd544746923)

commit_message:
undercloud: create EnableValidations

If validations are enabled, set EnableValidations to true.
It'll allow containerized undercloud to run workbooks usually executed
by instack-undercloud, in
THT/extraconfig/post_deploy/undercloud_post.sh.

Change-Id: I10abed7f1514e9d72d5ebac0c85bad11cdf3210f

subject: Flush console log file before retrieving content
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 13:43:16.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/serialconsoleops.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsolehandler.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/serialconsolehandler.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsoleops.py'], 'message': "Flush console log file before retrieving content

Hyper-V exposes instance serial console ports through named pipes.
We're consuming those named pipes, logging the output to a file,
retrieving the content when the console output is requested.

The issue is that the log file used by os-win never gets flushed
(unless closed). For this reason, we're returning incomplete output.

This change ensures that we're flushing the log file before attempting
to read its content.

Closes-Bug: #1741494

Change-Id: Ic558b16b317e0b1478cc259327d1336f7589afe3
Depends-On: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
(cherry picked from commit eb2c7b20a3e1328c1f3f5569bb5956a8ec230e8b)
"}]
commit_message:
Flush console log file before retrieving content

Hyper-V exposes instance serial console ports through named pipes.
We're consuming those named pipes, logging the output to a file,
retrieving the content when the console output is requested.

The issue is that the log file used by os-win never gets flushed
(unless closed). For this reason, we're returning incomplete output.

This change ensures that we're flushing the log file before attempting
to read its content.

Closes-Bug: #1741494

Change-Id: Ic558b16b317e0b1478cc259327d1336f7589afe3
Depends-On: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
(cherry picked from commit eb2c7b20a3e1328c1f3f5569bb5956a8ec230e8b)

commit_message:
Use stable-pike build of horizon for stable/pike

This patch changes tox to use the appropriate stable
build of Horizon.

We are currently always pulling the very latest version
of Horizon for all our gates. This is usually fine for the 
first few months, but over time it's likely that Horizon 
introduces changes that will break the designate-dashboard tests
and block the gate.

Change-Id: I3cecd9e1adce7ef0748f181050ed5d7cbe0da317
Closes-Bug: #1754269

commit_message:
Remove @expression from tags

This change makes tags a property of Project instead of a hybrid_property
since we will always have a Project contain some list of tags.

commit_message:
Add custom action to add dns entries via novajoin

When TLS is setup using novajoin, the IdM server should be
used for DNS.  This patch provides custom actions/workflow to
create the required entries through a call to novajoin.

This patch partially resolves BZ 1534070.

Change-Id: I6bd2dd42e57cf84dadce6476317d3a118bf14110

commit_message:
WIP: Add DNS data to IdM

When TLS is set up using novajoin and IdM, the IdM server should
be used for DNS.  This patch provides DNS data to novajoin so that
it can add it to IdM in two ways.
* by adding VipDnsData to the instance metadata to be processed on
  server instantiation.
* by calling a custom action to add entries when the deployment
  is complete

Change-Id: Ia8a282a2f8c2a6941c4e8735c797b01fd3790a63
Depends-On: I6bd2dd42e57cf84dadce6476317d3a118bf14110

commit_message:
[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & localhost

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and localhost.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8072cc842291d133fde9fdfe9e8ad432623a8ef2
Related-Bug: #1754607

subject: Add ansible-lint rule for apt_repository
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-07 20:37:28.000000000', 'files': ['ansible-lint/APTRepositoryCacheUpdateRule.py'], 'message': 'Add ansible-lint rule for apt_repository

This rule is designed to prevent the Ansible module `apt_repository`
from being used to update the APT cache. There is a bug [1] in
`apt_repository` that prevents cache updates from being performed
whenever the module is retried. If the cache update fails at the first
attempt, it is skipped on the subsequent attempt of the task causing the
task to always complete successfully. Until this bug is addressed this
rule should prevent it from being introduced into OpenStack-Ansible.

Partial-bug: 1750656

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/36605

Change-Id: If440ce129c31fb4e62a8e0ac5094195f4d4d7167
(cherry picked from commit 67bfc907030d7f0ce6fbb63f0608aa021f0b5400)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ansible-lint rule for apt_repository

This rule is designed to prevent the Ansible module `apt_repository`
from being used to update the APT cache. There is a bug [1] in
`apt_repository` that prevents cache updates from being performed
whenever the module is retried. If the cache update fails at the first
attempt, it is skipped on the subsequent attempt of the task causing the
task to always complete successfully. Until this bug is addressed this
rule should prevent it from being introduced into OpenStack-Ansible.

Partial-bug: 1750656

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/36605

Change-Id: If440ce129c31fb4e62a8e0ac5094195f4d4d7167
(cherry picked from commit 67bfc907030d7f0ce6fbb63f0608aa021f0b5400)

subject: Add deploy_status to plan-environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-07 15:29:54.000000000', 'files': ['plan-environment.yaml'], 'message': "Add deploy_status to plan-environment

Now that we support deploying via --config-download, it's no longer
possible for e.g the UI to monitor the status of the plan deployment
via the heat stack status, so add a status key to the plan-environment.

This can be used to check the status of the plan deployment after the
plan create/update/delete has finished (e.g there's no status on the
zaqar queue to consume).

The mistral workflows that manage the plan lifecycle will update the
value as appropriate, e.g:

CREATED - plan validated and created in swift
DEPLOYING - deployment is in-progress (either heat or configuration)
ERROR - deployment failed with some error
DELETED - plan still exists but the deployment has been deleted

We could consider splitting DEPLOYING perhaps to differentiate
the heat stack (PROVISIONING?) phase with the ansible/config-download
phase (CONFIGURING?)

Change-Id: I9a08bcd45be082b0050cb77ca9587520da5f8280
"}]
commit_message:
Add deploy_status to plan-environment

Now that we support deploying via --config-download, it's no longer
possible for e.g the UI to monitor the status of the plan deployment
via the heat stack status, so add a status key to the plan-environment.

This can be used to check the status of the plan deployment after the
plan create/update/delete has finished (e.g there's no status on the
zaqar queue to consume).

The mistral workflows that manage the plan lifecycle will update the
value as appropriate, e.g:

CREATED - plan validated and created in swift
DEPLOYING - deployment is in-progress (either heat or configuration)
ERROR - deployment failed with some error
DELETED - plan still exists but the deployment has been deleted

We could consider splitting DEPLOYING perhaps to differentiate
the heat stack (PROVISIONING?) phase with the ansible/config-download
phase (CONFIGURING?)

Change-Id: I9a08bcd45be082b0050cb77ca9587520da5f8280

subject: Mock retry in test_remove_block_dev
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-13 16:01:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_mgmt.py'], 'message': 'Mock retry in test_remove_block_dev

test_remove_block_dev was a very long running test. It was not mocking
retrying.retry and the retries would continue until the retry timeout
was hit. This adds test_remove_block_dev_timeout which mocks retry
while verifying the RetryError device deletion failure case to reduce
the test runtime.

Change-Id: I8cf674cb48d672bde3ce44660bc619aa4c914e62
'}]
commit_message:
Mock retry in test_remove_block_dev

test_remove_block_dev was a very long running test. It was not mocking
retrying.retry and the retries would continue until the retry timeout
was hit. This adds test_remove_block_dev_timeout which mocks retry
while verifying the RetryError device deletion failure case to reduce
the test runtime.

Change-Id: I8cf674cb48d672bde3ce44660bc619aa4c914e62

commit_message:
Support disabling a cell

It would be useful to have a mechanism by which we could totally stop
scheduling to a particular cell or a group of cells by supporting the
concept of disabling cells. Given that we do not have any existing
means to disable a cell, this spec proposes a simple solution to
support this new feature in nova.

Change-Id: I22bfe4dbe8325e57cef9959c38adda94fef28d73
Implements: blueprint cell-disable

commit_message:
use defusedxml to avoid XML attack

According to https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/api/bandit.blacklists.html

Using various XML methods to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable
to XML attacks. Methods should be replaced with their defusedxml equivalents.

Change-Id: Icdd807c8fd47ce0df3e292eef910e6e6e7610686
Partial-Bug: #1732155

commit_message:
crypto: Remove unused functions

These top-level functions were not called from anywhere but tests.

- fetch_ca
- ensure_ca_filesystem
- fetch_crl
- decrypt_text
- revoke_certs_by_user
- revoke_certs_by_project
- revoke_certs_by_user_and_project
- generate_x509_cert
- generate_vpn_files

These other functions are used by the above and are no longer used
anywhere.

- ca_folder
- ca_path
- key_path
- crl_path
- revoke_cert
- _project_cert_subject
- _user_cert_subject
- _ensure_project_folder
- sign_csr
- _sign_csr

Tests for these are removed as are a number of scripts found in
'nova/CA', which were only used by the aforementioned functions.

Change-Id: Ie1dadc6bf935f777e0cd0c54a0a21b79545714c5

commit_message:
Allow for merging traits and aggregates

Per discussions at the PTG [1] as concluded in IRC [2][3][4],
update_provider_tree needs to set and unset only the traits and
aggregate associations it "owns", rather than replacing them wholesale.
To facilitate this, we're adding ProviderTree methods add_traits,
remove_traits, add_aggregates, and remove_aggregates.

[1] Awkwardly pasted, since no etherpad permalink: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/698758/
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/nova_scheduler/2018/nova_scheduler.2018-03-12-14.00.log.html#l-217
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-03-12.log.html#t2018-03-12T16:08:09
[4] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-03-12.log.html#t2018-03-12T18:29:56

Change-Id: I0a1ffa4e3849ea5ed9f5252c38e5cf646eebfd62

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-09 21:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/memcached_hardening-3d6984c9b6e5f3f3.yaml', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': '[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & localhost

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and localhost.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8072cc842291d133fde9fdfe9e8ad432623a8ef2
Related-Bug: #1754607
(cherry picked from commit 74fc85c507fc298828797c51255cee059a9684fc)
'}]
commit_message:
[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & localhost

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and localhost.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8072cc842291d133fde9fdfe9e8ad432623a8ef2
Related-Bug: #1754607
(cherry picked from commit 74fc85c507fc298828797c51255cee059a9684fc)

subject: Updating time for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-12 20:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/smoke/test_containers.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/smoke/test_consumers.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_containers.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/smoke/test_secrets.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_acls.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_consumers.py'], 'message': 'Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67
'}]
commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I59707cdf21f6843dbd7db30978e21cff72756e67

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-09 09:20:47.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix for difference in tzinfo.tzname value between py27 and py35

The tzinfo.tzname value differs between py27 and py35.
For example, 'UTC' for py27, 'UTC+00:00' for py35.
Therefore, it is necessary to change the way to get the date string.

Change-Id: Iae5539e0aec0fab0a08640f7f6600a1d91b241e5
Closes-Bug: #1753644
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for difference in tzinfo.tzname value between py27 and py35

The tzinfo.tzname value differs between py27 and py35.
For example, 'UTC' for py27, 'UTC+00:00' for py35.
Therefore, it is necessary to change the way to get the date string.

Change-Id: Iae5539e0aec0fab0a08640f7f6600a1d91b241e5
Closes-Bug: #1753644

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 11:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/sources.list.debian'], 'message': "base: use ERP:kolla:queens repo for Debian

At Linaro we try to keep repositories with extra packages as separate as
it is possible. ERP:kolla is used for 'master' builds and we had

commit_message:
base: use ERP:kolla:queens repo for Debian

At Linaro we try to keep repositories with extra packages as separate as
it is possible. ERP:kolla is used for 'master' builds and we had
'ERP:kolla:pike' in past.

So I created 'ERP:kolla:queens' repo for stable/queens builds.

Change-Id: I6de4e1d1bf214f364b907ab85a0d0eeb233b4952

subject: Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-07 08:24:36.000000000', 'files': ['masakarimonitors/ha/masakari.py', 'masakarimonitors/tests/unit/ha/test_masakari.py'], 'message': 'Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors

In the next openstacksdk release, Profile is going away as are entrypoints
plugins. This handles fixing most of that in a way that should work with
both old and new.

Note: This code has been tested with a version other than
openstacksdk-0.10.0.

Change-Id: Ic6390b0a479529600d246e3ced9e7278f08054df
'}]
commit_message:
Update for upcoming openstacksdk changes to masakari-monitors

In the next openstacksdk release, Profile is going away as are entrypoints
plugins. This handles fixing most of that in a way that should work with
both old and new.

Note: This code has been tested with a version other than
openstacksdk-0.10.0.

Change-Id: Ic6390b0a479529600d246e3ced9e7278f08054df

commit_message:
Use node traits during upgrade

Now that the queens branch has support for node traits in the devstack
plugin [1], we can apply node traits when testing upgrades from queens
or later.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/551938

Change-Id: I99b9487d849ecd5241657d6ca91c2e9f9f7dfcf8
Related-Bug: #1722194
Related-Bug: #1750027

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-03-12 20:26:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/cinder'], 'message': 'Remove default value for Cinder Auth Strategy

Cinder supports both noauth and keystone auth mode. So now we can
configure this value via local.conf:

[[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
auth_strategy = noauth

Change-Id: I1e434362117ab30dae71a8f3a80bc139e78f51bc
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default value for Cinder Auth Strategy

Cinder supports both noauth and keystone auth mode. So now we can
configure this value via local.conf:

[[post-config|$CINDER_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
auth_strategy = noauth

Change-Id: I1e434362117ab30dae71a8f3a80bc139e78f51bc

subject: Make test allowed_pattern type same as the hot example and fix the gate

This reverts commit 51818f07d12d7eb776dc480585c2df23fbaf812a and forward
ports the testing change from stable pike:

In murano allowed_pattern set as:
allowed_pattern: [A-Za-z0-9]
But in hot example is set as:

So change the test template allowed_pattern.

(cherry picked from commit a682d5ee923912f9bdff49f9c5dc1847a40e7c33)
"}]
commit_message:
Make test allowed_pattern type same as the hot example and fix the gate

This reverts commit 51818f07d12d7eb776dc480585c2df23fbaf812a and forward
ports the testing change from stable pike:

In murano allowed_pattern set as:
allowed_pattern: [A-Za-z0-9]
But in hot example is set as:
allowed_pattern: '[a-zA-Z0-9]*'

So change the test template allowed_pattern.

Change-Id: I89ac4ef9de5eb0a5176c9df2ce1f289ca0d2cc65
(cherry picked from commit a682d5ee923912f9bdff49f9c5dc1847a40e7c33)

commit_message:
Allow to configure max vlans for trunk port tests

In NFV baremetal deployments, the number of vlans available for trunk
ports may be constrained. This patch allows to configure
max_networks_per_project to accommodate for those environments.

Change-Id: Ie0f04649313aed41498cf60f7de0eb44cee17b1c

subject: Remove customizable for plugins_pip_packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-23 13:23:17.000000000', 'files': ['docker/neutron/neutron-server-ovn/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/neutron/neutron-metadata-agent-ovn/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/neutron/neutron-server-opendaylight/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/neutron/neutron-server/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/nova/nova-compute/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/keystone/keystone/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': "Remove customizable for plugins_pip_packages

The pip packages are normally already configurable with the
<image_name>_pip_packages variable. It doesn't make much sense to make
the list of packages installed with the plugins mechanism configurable
via the <image_name>_plugins_pip_packages variable too.

And even if we wanted to, the parameter to the `customizable()`
function should be 'plugins_pip_packages' and not 'pip_packages'.

This commit removes the customizable bits from the plugins install
macro, at least until we get a good use case for it.

Change-Id: I90dd28b8c5d981e6028af353e34645712ef09b0b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove customizable for plugins_pip_packages

The pip packages are normally already configurable with the
<image_name>_pip_packages variable. It doesn't make much sense to make
the list of packages installed with the plugins mechanism configurable
via the <image_name>_plugins_pip_packages variable too.

And even if we wanted to, the parameter to the `customizable()`
function should be 'plugins_pip_packages' and not 'pip_packages'.

This commit removes the customizable bits from the plugins install
macro, at least until we get a good use case for it.

Change-Id: I90dd28b8c5d981e6028af353e34645712ef09b0b

This change makes it easier to configure the Kafka package. This
is useful, for example, when installing Monasca which currently
requires an older version of Kafka than that installed here.

The change also fixes an issue with circular symlinks, updates
kafka and verifies the sha512sum of the package. The sha512sum
was taken from here:

https://www.apache.org/dist/kafka/1.0.1/kafka_2.12-1.0.1.tgz.sha512

commit_message:
Support configuration of Kafka package

This change makes it easier to configure the Kafka package. This
is useful, for example, when installing Monasca which currently
requires an older version of Kafka than that installed here.

The change also fixes an issue with circular symlinks, updates
kafka and verifies the sha512sum of the package. The sha512sum
was taken from here:

https://www.apache.org/dist/kafka/1.0.1/kafka_2.12-1.0.1.tgz.sha512

Change-Id: I79a5a32ee8e5edd915fa88fbc00d0d4ac08b8ebd
Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles

subject: Move gnocchi api in wsgi back to python2
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-12 11:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/basic_gnocchi_spec.rb', 'manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_storage_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/gnocchi-api-back-py2-6635481aaf28ac36.yaml', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_wsgi_apache_spec.rb', 'manifests/storage.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_api_spec.rb', 'manifests/storage/ceph.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_storage_ceph_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Move gnocchi api in wsgi back to python2

Canonical are packaging gnocchi-api package with apache
and python3 by default. We cannot test it in CI since
we cannot run py2 and py3 on the same node with apache wsgi.

Canonical helped us by packaging python2 support back into
python-gnocchi package so we change our wsgi usage to use
this package and set the new wsgi script path.

We still want users to be able to install only gnocchi-api
since they might not run apache wsgi even though its installed by
default.

Adds installation of rados and redis packages for python3
when needed, this is because all gnocchi components will
still be running in py3, also CLI such as gnocchi-upgrade
but the gnocchi-api is in wsgi using py2. Because of that
we still need to install the py2 packages.

Enables acceptance testing for Debian based operating systems.

Change-Id: I070f88dd40ca4129cbd3abf5b4f5ecb511b2895e
(cherry picked from commit 56794f300acaf0c2dd46a0bac3830f7c90120670)
'}]
commit_message:
Move gnocchi api in wsgi back to python2

Canonical are packaging gnocchi-api package with apache
and python3 by default. We cannot test it in CI since
we cannot run py2 and py3 on the same node with apache wsgi.

Canonical helped us by packaging python2 support back into
python-gnocchi package so we change our wsgi usage to use
this package and set the new wsgi script path.

We still want users to be able to install only gnocchi-api
since they might not run apache wsgi even though its installed by
default.

Adds installation of rados and redis packages for python3
when needed, this is because all gnocchi components will
still be running in py3, also CLI such as gnocchi-upgrade
but the gnocchi-api is in wsgi using py2. Because of that
we still need to install the py2 packages.

Enables acceptance testing for Debian based operating systems.

Change-Id: I070f88dd40ca4129cbd3abf5b4f5ecb511b2895e
(cherry picked from commit 56794f300acaf0c2dd46a0bac3830f7c90120670)

commit_message:
Define devstack services without the test-matrix

Emit a disable_all_services and define which service we run in
the job directly. This drops the dependency from the test matrix,
from devstack default list of services and it makes it easier for
jobs to add/remove services based on the list in the base job.

Change-Id: Ib1debefd541b933dbfc54d484c263cc0ed60423d

commit_message:
Reduce stestr concurrency to 1 for tempest jobs

The switch from testr to stestr introduced in Change-Id
Icf1f9eb4539666dffb6c9c1651670541523a9f9e missed setting concurrency
jobs to 1 for api and scenario tests, leading to intermittent gate
issues.

This patch also fixes coverage test that got broken in the
aforementioned Change-Id.

Change-Id: I052a9c3b376624f8e9e63faa98f4d09a93bdde4d

commit_message:
Add nfs as a cinder backup driver option to CinderBackupBackend

Added nfs as an option to where CinderBackupBackend was hardcoded
as either ceph or swift. Also added some parameters for this
driver - CinderBackupNfsShare and CinderBackupNfsMountOptions

Change-Id: Id155e59703bf8b14da33ae54482b9d3bfcc4115e
Closes-Bug: #1744174

commit_message:
Pass user context to virt driver when detaching volume

We need this in a later change to pull volume attachment
information from cinder for the volume being detached so
that we can do some attachment counting for multiattach
volumes being detached from instances on the same host.

(cherry-picked from commit d2941bfd165055348dd584b630d4e631ef05e328)

Change-Id: If6e869b1c3516220b7deb0599d699caa2ed33889
Related-Bug: #1752115
(cherry picked from commit e27b94287739207640b37ffd3e3a6b4176ef7cd3)

This will provide the ability to indicate that the rescue disk image

commit_message:
Virtual instance rescue with stable disk devices

This will provide the ability to indicate that the rescue disk image
should be attached as a transient disk device (ie USB stick), so that
existing storage attached to an instance doesn't change its device
address during rescue mode.

This version of the spec for Queens additionally describes changes to
the REST API requested during Newton.

Previously-approved: Mitaka, Newton

Change-Id: I6f9a7aa7e5306988230ae4c19045efc70c582244
Blueprint: virt-rescue-stable-disk-devices

commit_message:
Update config option for collecting sensor data

This patch updates the notification driver option for collecting sensor
data because [DEFAULT]/notification_driver is deprecated and
'messaging' driver should only be used in cases where there are existing
consumers deployed which do not support the 2.0 message format.

Change-Id: Ia6c55149e5cb12d1201742f7008047e35570b410

commit_message:
Moving to diskimage-builder

This patch makes it possible to build the Virtualbox-compatible OVA
archive withouth using vagrant, virtualbox, or vmware-specific tools.

Currently the created ova archive can be imported on VirtualBox and
VMWare Player, the disk image itself can be used with libvirt
(qemu-kvm). It contains all the drivers that enables using it
as a desktop system with shared clipboard, auto-resizing display, etc.

Since the diskimage-builder method installs in chroot, there is no way
to pre-install devstack by running stack.sh. The image makes a best
effort including all the deb and pip packages to make the first run of
stack.sh as short as possible.

Change-Id: Ie1f6e44db7e0af8d072cfdf16ace1ba3f749c246

commit_message:
[CVE-2018-1000115] memcached: restrict to TCP & localhost

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2018-1000115

Restrict Memcached to only work on TCP and localhost.
The restriction is made at the application and firewall levels.
It will prevent DDoS amplification attacks using memcached.

Change-Id: I8072cc842291d133fde9fdfe9e8ad432623a8ef2
Related-Bug: #1754607
(cherry picked from commit 74fc85c507fc298828797c51255cee059a9684fc)

commit_message:
Implements validate_rescue() for IRMCVirtualMediaBoot

This commit implements validate_rescue() for 'irmc-virtual-media'
boot interface of 'irmc' hardware type.

With this it enables 'agent' rescue interface for 'irmc' hardware
type when corresponding boot interface being used is
'irmc-virtual-media'. Support already exists for the 'agent'
rescue interface with 'irmc-pxe' boot interface.

Also fix a bug in _remove_share_file() causing files
not to be removed correctly.

Change-Id: Ib602b2705b8fa4f7161b9f97857ec6546f5e9b19
Closes-Bug: #1747842

commit_message:
Add LXC swap metric collector and fix lxc bug

LXC plugin throw up a exception when try collect cpu metrics. This
patch fix it (tests are passing) and add swap collector.

Change-Id: I3b12ac6ce199006bc1e024d2b2626657519e4f0b
Story: 2001563
Task: 6507

commit_message:
Pass user context to virt driver when detaching volume

We need this in a later change to pull volume attachment
information from cinder for the volume being detached so
that we can do some attachment counting for multiattach
volumes being detached from instances on the same host.

(cherry-picked from commit d2941bfd165055348dd584b630d4e631ef05e328)

Change-Id: If6e869b1c3516220b7deb0599d699caa2ed33889
Related-Bug: #1752115

subject: Flush console log file before retrieving content
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-05 16:49:24.000000000', 'files': ['compute_hyperv/nova/serialconsoleops.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsolehandler.py', 'compute_hyperv/nova/serialconsolehandler.py', 'compute_hyperv/tests/unit/test_serialconsoleops.py'], 'message': "Flush console log file before retrieving content

Hyper-V exposes instance serial console ports through named pipes.
We're consuming those named pipes, logging the output to a file,
retrieving the content when the console output is requested.

The issue is that the log file used by os-win never gets flushed
(unless closed). For this reason, we're returning incomplete output.

This change ensures that we're flushing the log file before attempting
to read its content.

Closes-Bug: #1741494

Change-Id: Ic558b16b317e0b1478cc259327d1336f7589afe3
Depends-On: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d
"}]
commit_message:
Flush console log file before retrieving content

Hyper-V exposes instance serial console ports through named pipes.
We're consuming those named pipes, logging the output to a file,
retrieving the content when the console output is requested.

The issue is that the log file used by os-win never gets flushed
(unless closed). For this reason, we're returning incomplete output.

This change ensures that we're flushing the log file before attempting
to read its content.

Closes-Bug: #1741494

Change-Id: Ic558b16b317e0b1478cc259327d1336f7589afe3
Depends-On: I4b5eb7579ac0c92e9c3630539b0c4d76f5b98c6d

commit_message:
use is_extension_supported from neutron-lib

The is_extension_supported function now lives in neutron-lib. This patch
removes the function from neutron and uses lib's version instead.

NeutronLibImpact

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2017-08-23 10:31:42.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/keystone.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_keystone.py', 'devstack/lib/ironic', 'ironic/conf/conductor.py', 'etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py', 'ironic/conf/auth.py', 'ironic/conf/service_catalog.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_iscsi_deploy.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_deploy_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/keystoneauth-adapter-opts-ca4f68f568e6cf6f.yaml'], 'message': "Introduce keystoneauth adapters for clients

Currently ironic explicitly or implicitly sets the API urls
for most services in the config.
This is quite fragile and we should move to discovery from
the keystone catalog eventually.

To support this, this patch registers `keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter`
options to all config sections for service clients auth.
Among others it exports `interfaces` option that we set to
['internal', 'public'] by default.
Other exported options are `service_type`, `service_name`, `region_name`
and `endpoint_override`.
The latter will eventually be used by all clients to specify a specific
endpoint to use (for example in noauth mode).

Effectively this patch starts to move all clients code to load client
configuration from config for all of auth, session and adapter.

The first to move is [service_catalog] section, with [conductor]api_url
option being deprecated in favor of [service_catalog]endpoint_override.
A sane default of 'service_type' = 'baremetal' is set for this config
section as well.

More patches moving other clients to consume these new options and
deprecate some other options will follow.

Change-Id: I1283ef3b4d736ac089df0cc74a5850a93b24b6ab
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Related-Bug: #1699542
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce keystoneauth adapters for clients

Currently ironic explicitly or implicitly sets the API urls
for most services in the config.
This is quite fragile and we should move to discovery from
the keystone catalog eventually.

To support this, this patch registers `keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter`
options to all config sections for service clients auth.
Among others it exports `interfaces` option that we set to
['internal', 'public'] by default.
Other exported options are `service_type`, `service_name`, `region_name`
and `endpoint_override`.
The latter will eventually be used by all clients to specify a specific
endpoint to use (for example in noauth mode).

Effectively this patch starts to move all clients code to load client
configuration from config for all of auth, session and adapter.

The first to move is [service_catalog] section, with [conductor]api_url
option being deprecated in favor of [service_catalog]endpoint_override.
A sane default of 'service_type' = 'baremetal' is set for this config
section as well.

More patches moving other clients to consume these new options and
deprecate some other options will follow.

Change-Id: I1283ef3b4d736ac089df0cc74a5850a93b24b6ab
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Related-Bug: #1699542

subject: Add reno for RBAC and client incompatibility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 13:17:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/RBAC-and-client-incompatibility-fdfeab326dfda3bf.yaml'], 'message': 'Add reno for RBAC and client incompatibility

Magnumclients older than 2.9.0 (<=2.80) can not create
certificates for RBAC enabled clients. Affects only

Change-Id: Idab265a41b1bf2da83d29eb942b9f4568ee4cf99
'}]
commit_message:
Add reno for RBAC and client incompatibility

Magnumclients older than 2.9.0 (<=2.80) can not create
certificates for RBAC enabled clients. Affects only
k8s_fedora_atomic. This patch adds the relevant reno.

Change-Id: Idab265a41b1bf2da83d29eb942b9f4568ee4cf99

second to report N358 (as comments indicate it was meant to) and
fixes the unit tests to check this.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 19564, 'name': 'Keith Schincke', 'email': 'keith.schincke@gmail.com', 'username': 'colonwq'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-15 12:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upload-swift-artifacts'], 'message': "Add file type check to upload-swift-artifacts

deploy-artifacts supports only 'RPM' and 'gzip compressed data' [1]
while upload-swift-artifacts will allow the uploading
of any file. deploy-artifacts will fail if an unsupported file
type is downloaded resutling in a stack deploy failure.

This update add a check_file function which will validate the
file type of each file before it is uploaded. The script will
exit with a failure if an unsupported file is attempted.

Change-Id: I8c46110fa2779b818bc5b7882788f5d8739c1d2a
1: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/deploy-artifacts.sh#L12-L23
"}]
commit_message:
Add file type check to upload-swift-artifacts

deploy-artifacts supports only 'RPM' and 'gzip compressed data' [1]
while upload-swift-artifacts will allow the uploading
of any file. deploy-artifacts will fail if an unsupported file
type is downloaded resutling in a stack deploy failure.

This update add a check_file function which will validate the
file type of each file before it is uploaded. The script will
exit with a failure if an unsupported file is attempted.

Change-Id: I8c46110fa2779b818bc5b7882788f5d8739c1d2a
1: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/deploy-artifacts.sh#L12-L23

subject: Pin puppet-systemd
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 22:33:48.000000000', 'files': ['Puppetfile_extras'], 'message': "Pin puppet-systemd

puppet-systemd recently added a breaking change to pull the module
parameter defaults via hiera. This only works in puppet >= 4.10.0 which
we are not using. So we need to pin to an earlier commit since we're
usign 4.8.x.

Change-Id: I11c8372eb20d9ff67bcc91897118061d7f193a54
Closes-Bug: #1755211
(cherry picked from commit bd5599ca59b168ce4785991c4165fa4196b8d78a)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin puppet-systemd

puppet-systemd recently added a breaking change to pull the module
parameter defaults via hiera. This only works in puppet >= 4.10.0 which
we are not using. So we need to pin to an earlier commit since we're
usign 4.8.x.

Change-Id: I11c8372eb20d9ff67bcc91897118061d7f193a54
Closes-Bug: #1755211
(cherry picked from commit bd5599ca59b168ce4785991c4165fa4196b8d78a)

Pin puppet-systemd

puppet-systemd recently added a breaking change to pull the module
parameter defaults via hiera. This only works in puppet >= 4.10.0 which
we are not using. So we need to pin to an earlier commit since we're
usign 4.8.x.

(cherry picked from commit 8777c2911a2de899bf0cb58487973962cf3ebcee)

commit_message:
Pin puppet-systemd

puppet-systemd recently added a breaking change to pull the module
parameter defaults via hiera. This only works in puppet >= 4.10.0 which
we are not using. So we need to pin to an earlier commit since we're
usign 4.8.x.

Change-Id: I11c8372eb20d9ff67bcc91897118061d7f193a54
Closes-Bug: #1755211
(cherry picked from commit bd5599ca59b168ce4785991c4165fa4196b8d78a)

commit_message:
remove unused common rpc apis

Today neutron.common.rpc has a handful of public constants and functions
that are not used outside of neutron. This patch removes those not
externally used and enhances the rpc.init function to accept extra
RPC exception modules (though it's not used today) to still support
the notion of "extra mods" for RPC.

This patch also paves the way for easier rehoming the module to
neutron-lib.

Change-Id: I51607216a39980c17807dcccace3ab66b549607b

subject: Fix use of tags with overcloud post configure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 11:32:44.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/provision-net.yml', 'ansible/overcloud-ipa-build.yml', 'ansible/overcloud-ipa-images.yml', 'ansible/overcloud-introspection-rules-dell-lldp-workaround.yml', 'ansible/overcloud-introspection-rules.yml'], 'message': "Fix use of tags with overcloud post configure

When specifying tags with 'kayobe overcloud post configure --tags <tags>', the
expected plays typically do not run. This seems to be due to an ansible bug,
where if a dynamically created group is referenced before creation, it will
remain empty. See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20360.

This change works around this issue by modifying the name of the dynamic groups
used in the post configure playbooks to be unique to each playbook.

Fixes: #138
(cherry picked from commit 77a41a9d0a37acd2d4c25bd7d969d965a9552428)

Change-Id: I7a884f538cfeba9d6b4b990ec445b5ad6f914193
"}]
commit_message:
Fix use of tags with overcloud post configure

When specifying tags with 'kayobe overcloud post configure --tags <tags>', the
expected plays typically do not run. This seems to be due to an ansible bug,
where if a dynamically created group is referenced before creation, it will
remain empty. See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/20360.

This change works around this issue by modifying the name of the dynamic groups
used in the post configure playbooks to be unique to each playbook.

Fixes: #138
(cherry picked from commit 77a41a9d0a37acd2d4c25bd7d969d965a9552428)

Change-Id: I7a884f538cfeba9d6b4b990ec445b5ad6f914193

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd init role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

In converting this role to use the common systemd_service role a
keystone_service dictionary was created in the defaults main.yml file.
This change follows the pattern of other services.

Change-Id: I70e1f6007d9f88f05ccdc737b210415274580a46
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Prevent a action completion multiple times

If action is completed for second time we must raise and propagate
exception to the client to prevent task completion twice.

Change-Id: I36c5a85da4549ecdf97f6b5996ba436f153dabe8
Closes-Bug: 1743662
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

subject: Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-12 10:06:31.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'swift/common/utils.py', 'swift/container/sharder.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange

Prematurely expanding an acceptor's namespace and bumping its
timestamp [1] was a terrible idea. The acceptor might send this
expanded namespace to other replicas of the root container before the
leader root has replicated the original acceptor namespace with the
same bumped timestamp. This results in the acceptor namespace being
expanded in the root before the donor has cleaved and before the donor
is deleted from the root!

The goal of expanding the acceptor's namespace was to prevent object
updates redirected from the donor during shrinking being considered as
misplaced.  This patch takes a different approach and introduces an
EXPANDING state. Now the acceptor's namespace is left unchanged until
shrinking completes, but its state is moved to EXPANDING. Then, when
shrinking completes, the donor forwards an updated acceptor shard
range to the acceptor which moves it back to ACTIVE state.

This also helps avoid a similar problem when shrinking the final shard
to the root: the root considers itself sharded while it has shard
ranges, so considers any object misplaced and was prone to moving
objects that the final shard range was in the process of cleaving to
the root. Now the root is also put into EXPANDING state when accepting
the final shrinking shard range.

Note: There is still further work needed to ensure that non-leader
roots learn that they are in EXPANDING state *before* any final shard
replica cleaves to them.

[1] Ie65cd4ce0abc98452163f6acdfad3cce5cdd216f

Change-Id: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b
"}]
commit_message:
Add EXPANDING state to ShardRange

Prematurely expanding an acceptor's namespace and bumping its
timestamp [1] was a terrible idea. The acceptor might send this
expanded namespace to other replicas of the root container before the
leader root has replicated the original acceptor namespace with the
same bumped timestamp. This results in the acceptor namespace being
expanded in the root before the donor has cleaved and before the donor
is deleted from the root!

The goal of expanding the acceptor's namespace was to prevent object
updates redirected from the donor during shrinking being considered as
misplaced.  This patch takes a different approach and introduces an
EXPANDING state. Now the acceptor's namespace is left unchanged until
shrinking completes, but its state is moved to EXPANDING. Then, when
shrinking completes, the donor forwards an updated acceptor shard
range to the acceptor which moves it back to ACTIVE state.

This also helps avoid a similar problem when shrinking the final shard
to the root: the root considers itself sharded while it has shard
ranges, so considers any object misplaced and was prone to moving
objects that the final shard range was in the process of cleaving to
the root. Now the root is also put into EXPANDING state when accepting
the final shrinking shard range.

Note: There is still further work needed to ensure that non-leader
roots learn that they are in EXPANDING state *before* any final shard
replica cleaves to them.

[1] Ie65cd4ce0abc98452163f6acdfad3cce5cdd216f

Change-Id: I43cb6285537a24163bfe1245fe15fe1f1393294b

commit_message:
Fix invalid role template generated for ComputeOvsDpdk

Previously fixed for the CephStorage and BlockStorage roles - issue also
occurs for the ComputeOvsDpdk role.
This role also uses_deprecated_params set to 'true' but doesn't have
any deprecated params; changed it to 'false' where appropriate.

Change-Id: Ic843e946ad27380b7f8ce28cd149c88c393918bf
Closes-Bug: 1754633
Related-Bug: 1750828

subject: Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-06 13:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/bifrost/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory

Bifrost uses the www-data user for nginx on debian/ubuntu, and nginx on
other platforms. Kolla-ansible currently uses the nginx user for all
platforms when creating a log directory. This change uses the www-data
user on debian/ubuntu when setting ownership of the bifrost nginx log
directory.

Change-Id: I142a158b6f2e8f8a46b684267f6fbb2a6e22a259
Closes-Bug: #1753750
'}]
commit_message:
Use www-data user for bifrost nginx log directory

Bifrost uses the www-data user for nginx on debian/ubuntu, and nginx on
other platforms. Kolla-ansible currently uses the nginx user for all
platforms when creating a log directory. This change uses the www-data
user on debian/ubuntu when setting ownership of the bifrost nginx log
directory.

Change-Id: I142a158b6f2e8f8a46b684267f6fbb2a6e22a259
Closes-Bug: #1753750

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-28 08:44:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py'], 'message': 'DNM PoC Enable VNC console access to Ironic nodes

This is an early prototype for vnc graphical console access to Nova
instances running on Ironic baremetal nodes.

It is really hacky for now and sole aim is to test this patch
I283ddf5aec64ae4934ec3cf63ee7e357a8a899b2 with real HW.

In general though this work depends on "VNC Graphical console" spec
being approved and implemented in Ironic and its counterpart in Nova.

Change-Id: I3e98b79e01c0b3ade5622ab058101e1348716b82
'}]
commit_message:
DNM PoC Enable VNC console access to Ironic nodes

This is an early prototype for vnc graphical console access to Nova
instances running on Ironic baremetal nodes.

It is really hacky for now and sole aim is to test this patch
I283ddf5aec64ae4934ec3cf63ee7e357a8a899b2 with real HW.

In general though this work depends on "VNC Graphical console" spec
being approved and implemented in Ironic and its counterpart in Nova.

Change-Id: I3e98b79e01c0b3ade5622ab058101e1348716b82

subject: Remove unnecessary locks
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-03-08 10:05:56.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/lang/v2/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary locks

All of these operations (fetch from dict and modify dict) are
already atomic in python implementations with GIL. These locks are
unnecessary.

Change-Id: I70a8efab61f4570ee00e04021949517fd4e6a20d
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary locks

All of these operations (fetch from dict and modify dict) are
already atomic in python implementations with GIL. These locks are
unnecessary.

Change-Id: I70a8efab61f4570ee00e04021949517fd4e6a20d

commit_message:
kernel: make ExtraKernelModules and ExtraSysctlSettings role-specific

Allow to configure extra Kernel modules and extra sysctl settings per role
and not only global to the whole deployment.
The two parameters that can be role-specific are ExtraKernelModules and
ExtraSysctlSettings.

Change-Id: Iaafd0133df7ecd01a338f1b4deb3b159c2d9c6f1
(cherry picked from commit da1ed3d19c54b5f60fdc883fd4f11f613914c854)

subject: Don't notify zaqar in publish_ui_logs_to_swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 08:59:47.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/plan_management.yaml'], 'message': "Don't notify zaqar in publish_ui_logs_to_swift

We shouldn't notify the main event queue when publishing logs: those are
run in a cron, so we're not waiting for messages from it. When it fails,
it can interrupt regular workflows.

Change-Id: Ifb17352c4a89e2a1ea7c014cf64a586b4e5a2859
Closes-Bug: #1754061
"}]
commit_message:
Don't notify zaqar in publish_ui_logs_to_swift

We shouldn't notify the main event queue when publishing logs: those are
run in a cron, so we're not waiting for messages from it. When it fails,
it can interrupt regular workflows.

Change-Id: Ifb17352c4a89e2a1ea7c014cf64a586b4e5a2859
Closes-Bug: #1754061

Some features like ct_clear are implemented in OVS 2.6 but Xenial uses
OVS 2.5.2. Devstack by default enables Ubuntu Cloud Archives and this
patch enables UCA on the gate for functional and fullstack tests with

commit_message:
Use UCA for functional and fullstack tests

Some features like ct_clear are implemented in OVS 2.6 but Xenial uses
OVS 2.5.2. Devstack by default enables Ubuntu Cloud Archives and this
patch enables UCA on the gate for functional and fullstack tests with
openvswitch 2.8.

Change-Id: I026abf016a0024e235825f18e280c35d01706bbb

commit_message:
Fix queue create/update without metadata modification

When metadata is not modified in queue create/update, the operation
failed. This problem was caused by the patch that changing `$scope`
handling[1]. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/497127/

Change-Id: Ia7a524c5991c63caa24be7effc1a3bdfb8f914c4
Closes-Bug: #1647995
(cherry picked from commit 89e908c5a2eb968230a799b48fff2c88c1fb1702)

subject: Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-05 18:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/bifrost/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts

Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within a container, so add a
host entry during bootstrap.

This was previously fixed by Ied378b4dd755788e75ad1814cecb5700732ba83e
but the logic in bifrost was changed [1], making it out of sync with
kolla-ansible, and triggering a write to /etc/hosts. This change applies
the new logic in bifrost to kolla-ansible, ensuring that the file will
not need to change in the container.

Longer term we should look at ways to make bifrost less eager to modify
/etc/hosts, accepting any file that will work for RabbitMQ.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/60b9a9917e987e321b97b0f611fc2c77813be8b0

Change-Id: I0ee05feae3630435b2ec52cfeddf33647a974ee0
Closes-Bug: #1661009
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround for Bifrost being unable to write to /etc/hosts

Bifrost cannot modify /etc/hosts from within a container, so add a
host entry during bootstrap.

This was previously fixed by Ied378b4dd755788e75ad1814cecb5700732ba83e
but the logic in bifrost was changed [1], making it out of sync with
kolla-ansible, and triggering a write to /etc/hosts. This change applies
the new logic in bifrost to kolla-ansible, ensuring that the file will
not need to change in the container.

Longer term we should look at ways to make bifrost less eager to modify
/etc/hosts, accepting any file that will work for RabbitMQ.

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/bifrost/commit/60b9a9917e987e321b97b0f611fc2c77813be8b0

Change-Id: I0ee05feae3630435b2ec52cfeddf33647a974ee0
Closes-Bug: #1661009

Deprecation notice is the last patch that merged

https://github.com/openstack/tempest-lib/blob/master/README.rst

commit_message:
Drop tempest-lib from g-r

It has been deprecated for some time already and has
seen its last release in 2016, so I'd say it is time
to cleanup the cruft.

Deprecation notice is the last patch that merged
into that git repo - see
https://github.com/openstack/tempest-lib/blob/master/README.rst
Everything else get's -2'ed and abandoned. so I don't think
it is a good dependency for OpenStack anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1753969
Change-Id: Ib4d550870bbdb85fb2a9df20d295015dd3f03597

subject: Don't set mysql_service_name for bifrost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-05 16:01:09.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/bifrost/templates/bifrost.yml.j2'], 'message': "Don't set mysql_service_name for bifrost

Bifrost will determine the name of the service for MySQL based on the OS
distro if mysql_service_name is not set. Setting it explicitly in
extra-vars was causing problems on systems that use mariadb.

Change-Id: I892b1c9cf636b9dfc1bacc92e1e2f0d066018260
Closes-Bug: #1753522
"}]
commit_message:
Don't set mysql_service_name for bifrost

Bifrost will determine the name of the service for MySQL based on the OS
distro if mysql_service_name is not set. Setting it explicitly in
extra-vars was causing problems on systems that use mariadb.

Change-Id: I892b1c9cf636b9dfc1bacc92e1e2f0d066018260
Closes-Bug: #1753522

subject: Fix queue create/update without metadata modification
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-05 05:31:03.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar_ui/static/dashboard/project/queues/steps/queue-metadata/queue-metadata.controller.js'], 'message': 'Fix queue create/update without metadata modification

When metadata is not modified in queue create/update, the operation
failed. This problem was caused by the patch that changing `$scope`
handling[1]. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/497127/

Change-Id: Ia7a524c5991c63caa24be7effc1a3bdfb8f914c4
Closes-Bug: #1647995
'}]
commit_message:
Fix queue create/update without metadata modification

When metadata is not modified in queue create/update, the operation
failed. This problem was caused by the patch that changing `$scope`
handling[1]. This patch fixes it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/497127/

Change-Id: Ia7a524c5991c63caa24be7effc1a3bdfb8f914c4
Closes-Bug: #1647995

commit_message:
Adding container support for VNF

This spec proposes adding support for container in Tacker. It proposes to
spawn a VNF as a container rather than a VM.

Change-Id: I27a27b1a364118380b6804b5ea6ce73a0ad2428d
blueprint: containerised-vnfs
Co-Authored-By: Bharath Thiruveedula <bharath_ves@hotmail.com>

commit_message:
Improve healthchecks

To help deployers with openstack ansible, we add these playbooks
on the deploy guide path. It makes it easier for everyone
to know the cause for failures: the common one would be caught
and documented.

Change-Id: Ia7cb6327dc887c859404930e238bd5462e2bbc72

commit_message:
Homogenize the topics conf variable on templates

In several templates the variable topics is configured
between simple quotes.
It is better to remove them to use the openstack default value.

Change-Id: I418c714240b38b2853a5c746203eac31588e841a

subject: Remove cap on websocket-client
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-03-13 02:00:50.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove cap on websocket-client

The new version contains support for Kubernetes core Workloads API.

To update to this version we need to:
a. Remove the cap on websocket-client
b. Alter the constrained version of websocket-client - to be co-installable
with openstack libs (python-zunclient) and kubernetes
c. Raise the minimum acceptable version fro kubernetes - to be compatible
with the wider range of websocket-client

a follow-on commit to do b and c after zuneclient is release will follow

Change-Id: I8f65ca4ffc1cab7a7eb0708884ee311a6aeb0e26
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cap on websocket-client

The new version contains support for Kubernetes core Workloads API.

To update to this version we need to:
a. Remove the cap on websocket-client
b. Alter the constrained version of websocket-client - to be co-installable
with openstack libs (python-zunclient) and kubernetes
c. Raise the minimum acceptable version fro kubernetes - to be compatible
with the wider range of websocket-client

a follow-on commit to do b and c after zuneclient is release will follow

Change-Id: I8f65ca4ffc1cab7a7eb0708884ee311a6aeb0e26
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Filter out conntrack entries with unknown protocol

This patch updates the legacy conntrack driver to skip listing
(and deleting) any conntrack entries  with an unknown protocol.

The conntrack driver currently handles sessions for
TCP/UDP/ICMP/ICMP6 protocols only.

Change-Id: I53439c3f614d1a6ae7b3d679c018065d700316c5
Closes-Bug: #1753507

commit_message:
murano internal authentication needs /v3

Missing [murano_auth] with auth_uri ending in '/v3' leads to
keystone authentication failures - murano uses old v2 keystone.

Change-Id: I41846ac4fa78da90e02d91e8d1cec7405178f7df
Closes-Bug: #1753480

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-01-18 09:21:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_serversV21.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "[WIP]Fix update server's wrong meta when update concurrently

TODO: add unit test cases.

In the current implementation, when multiple update server's
metadata API take place concurrently, problem will occour,
details can be found in bug discription.

The root reason of this error is:
1. we get origin meta in api code, use this as baseline and
update the increment change to origin meta, see ref[1].
2. but we get the db record again in db, and use the db
record as baseline, see ref[2].
Obviously, the baseline of change one and origin one is not
unified, finally, we get the wrong result when update concurrently.

This patch try to fix this error, we try to use original meta or
sys-meta as baseline to update meta.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/compute/api.py#L4019
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2741

Change-Id: I184c4530e15323746cee0fac61c6fe932c214913
Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
Closes-bug: #1650188
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Fix update server's wrong meta when update concurrently

TODO: add unit test cases.

In the current implementation, when multiple update server's
metadata API take place concurrently, problem will occour,
details can be found in bug discription.

The root reason of this error is:
1. we get origin meta in api code, use this as baseline and
update the increment change to origin meta, see ref[1].
2. but we get the db record again in db, and use the db
record as baseline, see ref[2].
Obviously, the baseline of change one and origin one is not
unified, finally, we get the wrong result when update concurrently.

This patch try to fix this error, we try to use original meta or
sys-meta as baseline to update meta.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/compute/api.py#L4019
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0fc702cc081bab09424f3d63f242ff8c8f1215ce/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L2741

Change-Id: I184c4530e15323746cee0fac61c6fe932c214913
Co-Authored-By: Zhenyu Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>
Closes-bug: #1650188

commit_message:
remove unnecessary conf imports

There are a bunch of files that define CONF but don't ever reference
it. This cleans that up, removing unnecessary imports.

In order to get flake8 to pass I also had to remove some (unrelated)
unused imports from touched files.

Change-Id: Ib96ebeeb5e4bfedb20afb02c56da1521df9fac4f

subject: Restore rally job
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-07 11:08:37.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rally/run.yaml', 'rally-jobs/task-mistral.yaml', '.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Restore rally job

Due to various changes in OpenStack and Rally CI, mistral-rally-task job
became broken.

Unfortunately, it took much time for Rally team to finish some
stuff(sorry for that) and migrate jobs for native Zuul V3 format.

This patch restores mistral-rally-task job which inherits from the job
which Rally team runs constantly on all inner patches.

Change-Id: Ia7177af9b3e1aaacf555f5c472c4f0471b796930
'}]
commit_message:
Restore rally job

Due to various changes in OpenStack and Rally CI, mistral-rally-task job
became broken.

Unfortunately, it took much time for Rally team to finish some
stuff(sorry for that) and migrate jobs for native Zuul V3 format.

This patch restores mistral-rally-task job which inherits from the job
which Rally team runs constantly on all inner patches.

Change-Id: Ia7177af9b3e1aaacf555f5c472c4f0471b796930

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-09 03:10:14.000000000', 'files': ['roles/ComputeOvsDpdk.yaml'], 'message': "DPDK deployment fails when there is no deprecated parameters

When no deprecated parameters in role_data and enabling flag
'uses_deprecated_params', deployment fails as the parameter_groups
has no parameters added to computeovsdpdk-role file. As there are
no deprecated parameters for this role, this flag should be disabled.
Closes-Bug: #1754546

Change-Id: I95c7683b56c82c2cd8d67863867ed8a4f617d1f0
"}]
commit_message:
DPDK deployment fails when there is no deprecated parameters

When no deprecated parameters in role_data and enabling flag
'uses_deprecated_params', deployment fails as the parameter_groups
has no parameters added to computeovsdpdk-role file. As there are
no deprecated parameters for this role, this flag should be disabled.
Closes-Bug: #1754546

Change-Id: I95c7683b56c82c2cd8d67863867ed8a4f617d1f0

commit_message:
Add release note for keystone v2 removal

It is possible that some users might be slightly affected by this
change. Add a release note about the removal of keystone v2 in queens.

Since Queens already went out the door, this change is being proposed
only to the stable/queens branch so that it is properly rendered in the
Queens release notes page.

Change-Id: I9aaf7c9eff9000401bca9d4884675f0b1d9aeb3e

subject: Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-13 03:27:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_cinder.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/base.py'], 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Use test_data.cinder_data
- Use response.json attribute to decode responses as much as possible

APIResourceWrapper.to_dict() method of openstack_dashboard.api.base
is changed to refer attributes of an object itself instead of
self._apiresource. There is a case where APIResourceWrapper class
defines its own attributes and such attributes should be used in
to_dict() method. If self._apiresouce is referred these attributes
are not considered. We need to consume attributes of a class object
itself. It helps us write unit tests using sample test data.

Change-Id: I5b0c3bb52d97f377c6e5fe2b9a4ace2931114ab0
Partial-Bug: #1752917
'}]
commit_message:
Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Use test_data.cinder_data
- Use response.json attribute to decode responses as much as possible

APIResourceWrapper.to_dict() method of openstack_dashboard.api.base
is changed to refer attributes of an object itself instead of
self._apiresource. There is a case where APIResourceWrapper class
defines its own attributes and such attributes should be used in
to_dict() method. If self._apiresouce is referred these attributes
are not considered. We need to consume attributes of a class object
itself. It helps us write unit tests using sample test data.

Change-Id: I5b0c3bb52d97f377c6e5fe2b9a4ace2931114ab0
Partial-Bug: #1752917

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I05ad55cc6301429140069e4ebcb86e6a41c380b5

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia97c552e3d11495680275903da5dd4fb711aff87

subject: Add same launch instance error handling as image to instance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-09 22:43:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.controller.js'], 'message': 'Add same launch instance error handling as image to instance

Previously, when launching an instance with an instance snapshot rather
than with an image, the error handling was not as pleasant. I.e. the
volume size was not automatically set to the minimum size and the error
message would only appear after attempting to launch an instance. This
is a small patch that addresses this and makes the user experience more
friendly.

Change-Id: Ib694f66c74e90ee2e15201673de953c08cf10122
Closes-bug: #1752360
(cherry picked from commit 3233de8f0d13ad9e0223da9f1cf895aa30a6177e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add same launch instance error handling as image to instance

Previously, when launching an instance with an instance snapshot rather
than with an image, the error handling was not as pleasant. I.e. the
volume size was not automatically set to the minimum size and the error
message would only appear after attempting to launch an instance. This
is a small patch that addresses this and makes the user experience more
friendly.

Change-Id: Ib694f66c74e90ee2e15201673de953c08cf10122
Closes-bug: #1752360
(cherry picked from commit 3233de8f0d13ad9e0223da9f1cf895aa30a6177e)

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-03 13:51:52.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I76939b6c0f1d866b5bb80e169226887ac40758dd
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I76939b6c0f1d866b5bb80e169226887ac40758dd

commit_message:
Add stable/queens to the periodc-stable pipelines for some projects

The periodic-stable/networking-bagpipe/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27
job filed with[1]:

    ERROR! /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn not found

As did[2], [3] and [4]

I understand that using zuul-cloner isn't supported but switching to
tox-siblings hasn't happened yet in the mean time I assume this job
failed as stable/queens wasn't listed under branches.

So I admit I'm taking a wild guess here.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-bagpipe/stable/queens/openstack-tox-py27/5a05200/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-08_06_07_43_938740
